node.title: Woman who pretended to be volunteer firefighter for Black Summer disaster payments jailed
node.alt: The silhouette of a firefighter is seen in front of a large bushfire burning high into trees.
node.description: Over the course of months while devastating fires still burnt across the country, Sharon Tully Hill submitted petitions for money set aside for Rural Fire Service volunteers, receiving $190,000.
node.content:
["A woman who posed as a volunteer firefighter, despite never being one, to fraudulently claim disaster relief funds from the Black Summer bushfires has been sent to jail.", "Over the course of four months from January 2020, while devastating fires still burnt across the country, 49-year-old Sharon Tully Hill submitted 522 petitions online for money set aside for Rural Fire Service (RFS) volunteers.\u00a0", "Under the scheme, RFS members who were self employed or worked for small or\u00a0medium-sized\u00a0businesses could apply for up to $6,000 in lost income.\u00a0", "Hill was successful for 34 of those and received $190,000 in payments.\u00a0", "Hill is a resident of Lithgow, one of the communities threatened by the massive Gospers Mountain blaze.", "She is not, and never has been, a volunteer firefighter.\u00a0", "In May, Hill pleaded guilty to 34 counts of\u00a0dishonestly obtaining financial advantage by deception and four counts of attempting to do so.\u00a0", "She has also been sentenced for four counts of publishing false and misleading material for personal gain.\u00a0", "In the Lithgow Local Court today, she was sentenced to 30 months in prison, including a non-parole period of 15 months.", "It means her earliest release date will be April 2023.", "Hill has indicated an appeal will be lodged tomorrow and that she will be seeking bail.", "
Fighting the blaze
", "Properties in and around Lithgow were destroyed during the Gospers Mountain Fire which burnt more than half-a-million hectares across Blue Mountains, Hawkesbury, and Central Coast areas.\u00a0", "", "
Volunteer firefighters who\u00a0lost 10 days of work could claim relief payments for lost income.(ABC News: Jonathan Hair)
", "At its height, 3,000 firefighters fought Australia's first \"mega blaze\".", "It started in October 2019 and burnt for 79 days.", "In a statement at the time of the charges, the New South Wales RFS said it had \"zero tolerance for criminal behaviour\".\u00a0"]
